document_data.mainbody:
Fukada Shiro was a samurai lord and ally of the Hiro clan in Kozakura in 1357 DR.
Fukada owned the shoen surrounding the Gobo village. He directly controlled his land. He had at his disposal a company of thirty-six samurai and sixty bushi. Shiro was often called to Hiro castle and in those cases it was his son Fukada Takauji who managed the place.
Shiro was the head of a very small samurai clan, the Fukada family, allied with the Hiro clan.
